thread.title: Middletown miscues help Salesianum top Cavaliers 20-6
thread.title_full: Middletown miscues help Salesianum top Cavaliers 20-6

author: Mike Santa Barbara
title: Middletown miscues help Salesianum top Cavaliers 20-6
text: Middletown miscues help Salesianum top Cavaliers 20-6 Comment By Mike Santa Barbara Posted Oct. 9, 2015 @ 11:04 pm Weather delayed the start of perhaps the most anticipated match up of Friday night’s high school football schedule. Though, by the end of the night, several Middletown turnovers made the difference in a 20-6 Salesianum victory at Baynard Stadium. After forcing an early Middletown fumble, Garret Cannon opened the scoring Friday night, scoring on a quarterback-keeper from two-yards out to give Salesianum a 7-0 lead. The Sallies lead would hold steady at 7-0 into the second quarter when Salesianum would again capitalize off a Middletown turnover. Deep in their own territory, Salesianum’s Evan Mullin intercepted a Vincent DelPercio pass returning it near the goal-line. On the very next play Colby Reeder pounded in the score from 2-yards out to give Salesianum a 13-0 lead after the extra point was blocked by Middletown. Salesianum led 13-0 at half time. Middletown struck for their first points in the opening seconds of the second half when Kedrick Whitehead scored from 74-yards out. Salesianum blocked the extra point attempt, and the Cavaliers trailed Sallies 13-6. After the fourth turnover of the night for the Cavaliers, Salesianum was set up in great field position again, and once more they took advantage. Griffin Salvo scored from 25-yards out to give Salesianum a 20-6 lead, one they would hold throughout the third and fourth quarter. In the end, five Cavalier turnovers told the story Friday night at Baynard Stadium. The loss breaks a two-game win streak for Middletown who now stand at 3-2 on the year. The Cavaliers are back in action next Friday night when they travel to take on A.I. duPont at 7:30 p.m
